TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed TreeViewImageSet extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Represents an image set to use in the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The TreeViewImageSet enumeration is used to represent the different sets of images that can be displayed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control. You can select from a predefined set of images or create your own custom set by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.ImageSet%2A> property to the Custom value. When defining a custom set of images, you should specify an image for each of the properties in the following table. Otherwise, the default image for that property is used.
|Property|Description| |--------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.CollapseImageUrl%2A>|The URL to a custom image for the collapsed node indicator.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.ExpandImageUrl%2A>|The URL to a custom image for the expanded node indicator.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.LineImagesFolder%2A>|The URL to a folder that contains custom images for lines-connecting nodes.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.NoExpandImageUrl%2A>|The URL to a custom image for the non-expanding node indicator.|
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the TreeViewImageSet enumeration to indicate which image set to use in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control.
[!code-cs[TreeViewImageSet#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_63_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[TreeViewImageSet#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_63_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeViewImageSet Arrows = int32(10)

Docs.summary: A predefined set of arrow images.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeViewImageSet BulletedList = int32(6)

Docs.summary: A predefined set of diamond-shaped bullet images.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeViewImageSet BulletedList2 = int32(7)

Docs.summary: A predefined set of square-shaped bullet images.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeViewImageSet BulletedList3 = int32(8)

Docs.summary: A predefined set of sectioned, diamond shaped bullet images.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeViewImageSet BulletedList4 = int32(9)

Docs.summary: A predefined set of alternate sectioned, diamond shaped bullet images in sizes that vary by level.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeViewImageSet Contacts = int32(12)

Docs.summary: A predefined set of MSN Messenger–styled images.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeViewImageSet Custom = int32(0)

Docs.summary: A user-defined set of images. This is the default value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.ImageSet%2A>.

Docs.summary: A predefined set of event log–styled images.

Docs.summary: A predefined set of FAQ-styled images.

Docs.summary: A predefined set of e-mail–styled images.

Docs.summary: A predefined set of Microsoft MSDN developer program–styled images.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeViewImageSet News = int32(11)

Docs.summary: A predefined set of newsgroup-styled images.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeViewImageSet Simple = int32(4)

Docs.summary: A predefined set of simple-shaped outline images.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeViewImageSet Simple2 = int32(5)

Docs.summary: A predefined set of filled simple-shaped images.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeViewImageSet WindowsHelp = int32(3)

Docs.summary: A predefined set of Microsoft Windows Help–styled images.
